attribute-processor.name: decorator

documentation.reference: Thymeleaf Layout Dialect readme, section on Decorators and Fragments

attribute-processor.documentation: Specifies the name of the decorator template to apply to a content template. The mechanism for resolving decorator pages is the same as that used by Thymeleaf to resolve th:fragment and th:substituteby pages.

attribute-processor.name: include

documentation.reference: Thymeleaf Layout Dialect readme, section on Includes and Fragments

attribute-processor.documentation: Similar to Thymeleaf's th:include, but allows the passing of entire element fragments to the included template. Useful if you have some HTML that you want to reuse, but whose contents are too complex to determine or construct with context variables alone.

attribute-processor.name: fragment
attribute-processor.documentation: The glue that holds everything together; it marks sections in the decorator template that can be replaced by sections in the content template, which share the same name.

attribute-processor.name: title-pattern

documentation.reference: Thymeleaf Layout Dialect readme, section on Title Pattern

attribute-processor.documentation: Allows for greater control of the resulting <title> element by specifying a pattern with some special tokens. This can be used to extend the decorator's title with the content's one, instead of simply overriding it.
